item.title: Road needs sweeping, 27th November
item.description:
The road outside Churchill Gardens on Churchill Drive needs clearing of all leaves that have fallen from big Horse Chestnut tree. The road wasnâ€™t swept last year after the leaves had fallen so there is an accumulation of dead wet leaves making for a very dirty road and possibility of blocking drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Churchill Drive, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Series of dropped service drains across Station Road, 27th November
item.description:
There are a series of dropped service drains across Station Road between Waterside Close and Huntsmen's Meet estates. These dropped service drains are causing houses either side of them to have vibrations within the houses when the larger vehicles cross them. Obviously in time there will be significant damage to the houses from these vibrations that will almost certainly require legal intervention. This problem has been on-going for the last year and although Highways have been informed previously of the issues (ref's 6117710 and 5982663), they have deemed to close the reports as not important enough or not significant.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double drain gully is simply not working. It does not appear to be a question of leaves and believe gully was pumped very recently. Think this is a known problem as we have seen more than one work crews but clearly there is a fundamental problem., 27th November
item.description:
The double gully is as shown in the photo on the western side of Evesham Road directly opposite Hill Court Road. It should not be confused with a newly installed double gully a further up the road towards the roundabout which appears to be functioning well. As a matter of course local residents have been doing their best to keep both double gullies clear of leaves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
